intro: Oxydectes jatrophifolia, commonly known as the yellow brittle bladder, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow, bladder-like fruits that split open when mature. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its succulent leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered, often displaying a pale yellow to greenish hue. Oxydectes jatrophifolia is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
